disp-quote.p: The crude extract and solvent fractions of seeds of B. carinata were tested for antioxidant activity using DPPH free radical assay. The DPPH free radical scavenging activities of the B. carinata extracts were concentration dependent with an IC50 value of 3.45±0.12, 5.85±0.37, 10.54±0.57, and 15.64±0.42 mg/mL for the aqueous fraction, crude extract, ethyl acetate fraction, and the chloroform fraction, respectively. Higher free radical scavenging activity was observed in the aqueous fraction among other fractions ( Table 5).
